revised_title: Observations of Jupiter's Satellites and the Accuracy of Astronomical Instruments
tldr: This article presents observations of Jupiter's first satellite's eclipses made at the Royal Observatory in Greenwich and in North America. The author compares the observations and discusses the accuracy of different telescopes used, such as Short's reflectors and Dollond's achromatic telescopes. The author also explains the method to determine the true difference of meridians using a mean of immersion and emersion results.
